message.content:
Rule Learning, Theory. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating the quality of attributes in the context of machine learning from examples. It proposes to use RELIEFF, an extended version of the RELIEF algorithm, as an estimator of attributes for top-down induction of decision trees. This approach falls under the sub-category of Rule Learning. 

The paper also discusses the limitations of current inductive machine learning algorithms and proposes a new approach that shows a strong relation between RELIEF's estimates and impurity functions, which are usually used for heuristic guidance of inductive learning algorithms. This aspect of the paper falls under the sub-category of Theory.
